DOCNAME: CASE OF DEL SOL v. FRANCE
TEXT: CARDINAL . By a judgment of DATE , the GPE tribunal de grande instance made a divorce order terminating the marriage of PERSON and PERSON , ordered the liquidation and partition of the matrimonial property , set the level of maintenance to be paid to the applicant at MONEY ( ORG ) DATE and dismissed a claim for damages by the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that judgment , stating , inter alia , that her husband , the petitioner in the proceedings , had failed to satisfy the conditions set out in LAW , as he had no rights in the assets he had offered to leave her . She argued in the alternative that a divorce would cause her exceptional hardship and that her husband 's petition should be dismissed in accordance with LAW , which empowered the court to dismiss a divorce petition if the respondent showed that “ the divorce would cause the respondent ... or the children exceptional material or psychological hardship ... ” . The applicant also sought maintenance in the form of DATE payments of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld all the provisions of the impugned judgment , with the exception of the decision relating to maintenance , which was reduced to ORG CARDINAL DATE . It held , inter alia , that the applicant 's husband satisfied all the conditions on which the admissibility of the divorce petition depended , as he had offered to assign to the applicant his rights in property which the couple jointly owned in GPE . It further held that the applicant had failed to show that the divorce would cause her exceptional hardship , either psychologically or materially .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to ORG at ORG for legal aid to enable her to appeal to that court against ORG decision . Her application was refused on DATE on the ground that no arguable ground of appeal could be made out against the impugned judgment . ORG noted , however , that the applicant satisfied the means test for legal aid .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision . By an order of CARDINAL DATE the President of ORG upheld it , holding that ORG had “ found no arguable ground of appeal after assessing the facts of the case in its unfettered discretion ” .

CARDINAL . The NORP system of legal aid enabling persons of limited means to assert their right through the courts was established by Law no . CARDINAL of DATE and its implementing Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE .
Under LAW of the decree : “ Applications for legal aid ... shall contain the following information : ... the purpose of the application and a brief summary of the reasons ” .

Applications for legal aid are examined by the legal aid office of the court dealing with the case in respect of which the application is made . ORG at ORG is composed of a judge of that court , who acts as its president , the senior registrar who acts as vice - president , CARDINAL members chosen by ORG , CARDINAL civil servants , CARDINAL court officers CARDINAL at least of whom must be a lawyer and a member appointed by the general public ( section CARDINAL of the PERSON ) .

ORG may refuse an application under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the PERSON , which provides : “ In cases before ORG , an application for legal aid shall be refused if no arguable ground of appeal can be made out . ” An appeal lies against a decision of ORG to the President of ORG ( section CARDINAL of the PERSON ) .
